page.title: 15SHIPLEY COUNTRY PARK
page.content: {SHIPLEY COUNTRY PARK} Shipley Park is a large area of open and wooded countryside bounded by Heanor, Ilkeston and Smalley. It has been created out of the waste land left after coalmining which took place on Shipley Estate once owned by the Miller-Mundy family. Now the country park is popular for people in the towns, villages and schools nearby who want to spend time in the open air. {AMENITIES} In Shipley there are quite alot of facilities for people to come and spend some of their leisure time. There are ponds for fishing; Osbourne Pond, the boating lake and Adams Pond. There are plenty of picnic tables in the woodland or on the grassy hillsides. There are alot of people who keep fit on the Trim Track fitness exercises.
